attributes.comment:
I have just gotten word from our adoption agency that the USCIS is considering
raising it's fees for fingerprinting as well as for the I-600A/I171H forms. This
is very upsetting to me. As a future adoptive parent in the middle of the
process it is very frustrating and very costly, financially and emotinally. My
husband and I have already spent almost $10,000 in fees, with at least that more
remaining before we are able to bring our daughter home. Because of the short
expiration time on fingerprints and the I171H form, it is inevitable that we
will have to go through the stress and costs of re-applying for all this.
(China's wait time now is up to almost 24 months). If USCIS does not extend the
timeline for these forms and raises the costs, my husband and I are looking at
an additional $830 out of pockets in addition to what we have already paid and
we haven't even been able to use the fingerprints and I171H we paid nearly $800
for before! This is outrageous and unfair. We only want to give a love home to a
child who would otherwise not have one. Please reconsider raising these fees!!!

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Katherine W. McAdams
